subject: Climate & Environment
title: Microplastics Everywhere
description: Learn Microplastics Everywhere in one minute.

hook.text: Microplastics have been found in Arctic ice, deep ocean trenches, and human blood.

buildup.text: Plastic doesn't biodegrade. Instead it breaks into smaller and smaller fragments over time.

discovery.text: Pieces smaller than 5 millimeters are called microplastics. They're in water, air, and soil.

twist.text: A recent study found the average person ingests about a credit card's worth of plastic per week.

climax.text: Scientists are only beginning to understand what microplastics do inside the human body.
